details:
It was discovered that there were three vulnerabilities in the curl
command-line HTTP (etc.) client:


* [CVE-2018-16890](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16890)
A heap buffer out-of-bounds read vulnerability in
 the handling of NTLM type-2 messages.
* [CVE-2019-3822](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3822)
Stack-based buffer overflow in the handling of
 outgoing NTLM type-3 headers.
* [CVE-2019-3823](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3823)
Heap out-of-bounds read in code handling
 the end of a response in the SMTP protocol.


For Debian 8 Jessie, this issue has been fixed in curl version
7.38.0-4+deb8u14.


We recommend that you upgrade your curl packages.
